solution_line_template: First find the total Janet spends on clarinet lessons per week: ${clarinet_hourly_rate}/hour * {clarinet_hours_per_week} hours/week = $<<{clarinet_hourly_rate}*{clarinet_hours_per_week}={clarinet_weekly_cost}>>{clarinet_weekly_cost}/week

Then find the total Janet spends on piano lessons per week: ${piano_hourly_rate}/hour * {piano_hours_per_week} hours/week = $<<{piano_hourly_rate}*{piano_hours_per_week}={piano_weekly_cost}>>{piano_weekly_cost}/week

Then subtract her weekly clarinet spending from her weekly piano spending to find the weekly difference: ${piano_weekly_cost}/week - ${clarinet_weekly_cost}/week = $<<{piano_weekly_cost}-{clarinet_weekly_cost}={weekly_difference}>>{weekly_difference}/week

Then multiply the weekly difference by the number of weeks in a year to find the annual difference: ${weekly_difference}/week * {weeks_per_year} weeks/year = $<<{weekly_difference}*{weeks_per_year}={annual_difference}>>{annual_difference}/year
